item.title: Notes on the Bernoulli distribution
item.description: Bernoulli distribution describes an outcome of a single experiment with two possible outcomes (success or failure): \(X=1\) if an experiment was successfull, \(X=0\) if it was not. Parameter: \(p\) â€“ probability of a success. Values: \(\{0,1\}.\) Probability mass function: \[ P(X=1)=p, \ P(X=0)=1-p. \] Moment generating function: \[ M(t)=1-p+pe^t \] {} \[ M(t)=Ee^{tX}=e^t\cdot P(X=1)+e^0\cdot P(X=0)=pe^t+1-p \] All moments: \[ EX^n=p, \ n\geq 1. \] {} Observe that \(X^n=X,\) for \(n\geq 1.
